intro: Pseudosedum kuramense, commonly known as the Kurame sedum, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Pseudosedum kuramense is valued for its low maintenance requirements and ability to adapt to various growing conditions.
